intro: Doellingeria pubens, commonly known as the hairy doellingeria, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and prairies. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow with purple centers. Doellingeria pubens is often found in wetland ecosystems and is an important component of native plant communities.
